cards.blockReason: Created text is a text written by a non-native speaker for a non-native audience to achieve specific curricular goals. Created texts have been a common feature in language classrooms, but educators are increasingly using more authentic texts in their teaching.

cards.title: Task 7: Finalize sprint archiving and history browsing.
cards.description: Enable viewing and restoring historical states from Git history.

cards.title: Task 3: Implement dynamic loading for cards.
cards.description: Improve performance by loading only the cards displayed on the current screen  .

cards.title: Task 4: Introduce conflict management for Git operations.
cards.description: Add logic to handle Git conflicts gracefully when multiple users edit Kanban cards or the board.
cards.blockReason:
Created text is a text written by a non-native speaker for a non-native audience to achieve specific curricular goals. Created texts have been a common feature in language classrooms, but educators are increasingly using more authentic texts in their teaching. 
Here are some other types of text:
Semi-authentic text: Based on authentic language material, but can be for native or non-native audiences 
Authentic text: Produced by a native speaker for native readers 
Generated text: Automatically produced coherent and meaningful text, which can be in the form of sentences, paragraphs, or even entire documents 
AI writing generators can be used to generate text based on a prompt and a few settings. Some examples of AI writing generators include: 
Writer: Best for AI compliance
Writesonic: Best for content marketing

cards.title: Task 1: Enhance singleton to manage both local (all-in-one JSON) and Git (modular JSON) data.
cards.description:
Add methods for:
Splitting all-in-one JSON into modular files.
Reconstructing all-in-one JSON from modular files.

cards.title: Task 2: Update Git logic to handle the modular storage format.
cards.description:
Push and pull workflows:
Push: Serialize local JSON into board.json and card-{id}.json files.
Pull: Deserialize modular files into the local all-in-one JSON.

cards.title: Add needDate
cards.description: Add Need Date index to the Grid view
